TopicTitle: Are animations required to see the nozzle gimbal?

Articles.Content: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7196ru3wpjA Well i want my engine to make this moment (vectoring) but my doubt is i need to animate this ?

47 minutes ago, Kaleu said:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7196ru3wpjA Well i want my engine to make this moment (vectoring) but my doubt is i need to animate this ?

 

 

Maybe not you can make parts of a engine move with gimbal but to set it for just 2 directions might have to do some digging around what engine are you talking about would help.
Or you can set the gimbaltransform to thrust transform?

9 hours ago, Xd the great said:

Or you can set the gimbaltransform to thrust transform?

Thats close to what I said but that might not get all the want to move as the thrust transform is set to the bell so gimbal moves it if they want more to move they need to name it something else which one would have to see the model and what the want to move

Edited October 1, 2018 by Mecripp

17 hours ago, Kaleu said:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7196ru3wpjA Well i want my engine to make this moment (vectoring) but my doubt is i need to animate this ?

 

 

Animations are -not- required for a gimbal to 'rotate'.

Create your engine model with transforms in the proper positions and orientations, and the stock 'ModuleGimbal' will dynamically rotate the gimbal according to the inputs.  Examine some of the other engine models and see how they have set up their transforms (naming, orientation); compare this to their config files to see what transforms are referenced in the specific part-modules, and fill out your part config accordingly.

16 hours ago, Mecripp said:

Maybe not you can make parts of a engine move with gimbal but to set it for just 2 directions might have to do some digging around what engine are you talking about would help.

I Want it to move in all directions like the stock engines.
